props.synopsis: While some Tasmanian voters are concerned over the environmental impacts of salmon farming, supporters say the industry is critical to the state's economy.

title.children: Tasmanian voters divided over salmon farming industry

image.altText: Horses on a dirt paddock seen from the air.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian harness trainer Wayne Yole, the father of disqualified industry participants Ben and Tim Yole, is given until the end of the month to prove why he should be allowed to home, stable or train any horses.

title.children: Alleged breaches found during multi-agency search of Yole stables

image.altText: A young girl chopping vegetables with other kids in a kitchen.

props.synopsis: This kitchen is cooking up a plan to not only teach culinary skills, but to also inspire kids to develop — and keep — healthy eating habits.

title.children: Social enterprise kitchen hopes to inspire kids to cook and eat well

image.altText: Pauline Hanson with daughter Lee Hanson with some hot chips.

props.synopsis: Pauline Hanson, the leader of One Nation, has worked in politics for nearly three decades. Now, her daughter Lee is hoping to join her — running as a Senate candidate in southern Tasmania.

title.children: After years of urging, Pauline Hanson's daughter is running for One Nation

image.altText: A render of the proposed Macquarie Point stadium, showing a wood-panelled round structure

props.synopsis: A new economic report commissioned by the Hobart City Council has found the stadium will deliver more than $140 million in economic impact to Hobart per year during the construction phase, and $178 million when operational.

title.children: New Hobart stadium report sought to address economic 'missed opportunity'

image.altText: Tasmania Police badge

props.synopsis: A man who worked as a doctor in Tasmania in the 1990s is extradited from New South Wales and charged with three counts of rape and three counts of indecent assault.

title.children: Former Tasmanian GP extradited to Hobart to face rape charges

image.altText: Two men shakes head in front of a podium

props.synopsis: The major party leaders went head to head on national security and the cost of living, in a fiery debate hosted by Seven.

title.children: Dutton and Albanese spar over Welcome to Country ceremonies in final debate

image.altText: a campaign poster for Vivek Singha the Liberal candidate for Fowler in Western Sydney

props.synopsis: The ABC uncovers social media posts by Liberal candidate Vivek Singha in which he repeatedly uses a derogatory term for Indigenous Australians and takes aim at Environment Minister Tanya Plibersek over a personal family matter.

title.children: Liberal candidate for Western Sydney seat apologises for offensive posts

image.altText: Roy Conry stands behind a desk with equipment on it

props.synopsis: Toolmaking and engineering pattern-making was once a thriving industry and is still a critical part of the supply chain in Australia, but the sector has shrunk, leaving the remaining tradies struggling to keep up with demand.

title.children: The dying trade critical to keeping Australian manufacturing alive

image.altText: A photo of Samuel Hockey.

props.synopsis: A new nasal spray that uses a form of ketamine to treat stubborn depression will be added to the PBS, making treatment cheaper for thousands of Australians.

title.children: Ketamine-based nasal spray 'just the beginning' for depression patients

image.altText: police cars and lights on a street

props.synopsis: Vancouver Police say they are "confident" the incident was not an act of terrorism.

title.children: At least 11 dead after car drives into crowd in Vancouver

image.altText: Headshot of Donna Nelson wearing a black shirt with a garden behind her.

props.synopsis: Grandmother Donna Nelson sits alone in a Japanese jail for 23 hours a day, far from the life she planned with her online boyfriend of two years. The court accepted the 59-year-old was love scammed, but sentenced her anyway.

title.children: Donna's trip of a lifetime landed her in jail in Japan

image.altText: Liverpool players smile in red jersey with Champions on it

props.synopsis: Liverpool win the English Premier League with a 5-1 victory over Ange Postecoglou's Tottenham at Anfield.

title.children: Liverpool seal Premier League title with 5-1 rout of Ange's Spurs

image.altText: A large plume of smoke over the skyline of Beirut.

props.synopsis: Israel launches air strikes on the Lebanese capital Beirut, targeting what it claims was a Hezbollah missile store in the city's south.

title.children: Lebanon accuses Israel of breaching ceasefire with fresh strikes

image.altText: A line of people inside a marble church

props.synopsis: More than 150,000 people lined the route through Rome to visit Pope Francis's tomb and say farewell.

title.children: Thousands of people flock to see Pope Francis's tomb ahead of the conclave

image.altText: Pope Francis hugs Filipino Cardinal Luis Antonio Tagle.

props.synopsis: There's increasing hope among Catholics in the Philippines that one of their own, Cardinal Luis Tagle, who is considered a contender to succeed Pope Francis, and has a reputation for being a relatively open minded voice in the church might become Asia's first Pope.

title.children: Could this 'underdog' Filipino cardinal be a surprise contender for pope?

image.altText: Nathan Brown promotes a multi bet on television.

props.synopsis: The Sportsbet "live odds" segments hosted by former player Nathan Brown was an AFL television broadcast mainstay for years. Why have they suddenly stopped?

title.children: After the losses were revealed, these Sportsbet TV segments stopped

image.altText: A photo of China's crewed submersible, the Fendhouze, held aloft above the water before going in.

props.synopsis: China's new cable-cutter has been making headlines, but how much of a threat is it really?

title.children: What China's new cable-cutter signals for Australia

image.altText: Peter Dutton in a suit.

props.synopsis: If the world is re-arming, shouldn't we boosting funding for the public service?

title.children: As the world re-arms, should we treat our public service with more respect?

image.altText: A woman stands in front of a pink background wearing a silver glittery fress

props.synopsis: The news was announced by her family, who shared a statement on social media.

title.children: RuPaul's Drag Race star Jiggly Caliente dies, aged 44

image.altText: A sepia-tinged photo of a man holding a large crocodile.

props.synopsis: A crocodile wrangler from the country may sound like an unlikely advocate for LGBTQIA+ Australians in parliament. But Warren Entsch is just that — and it all started in a pub.

title.children: The out-of-the-blue reunion in a purple pub that changed Australia

image.altText: Dutton McKenzie winery

props.synopsis: Bridget McKenzie says the Coalition believes in principle that electric vehicle drivers should pay a road use charge and will consider one in government, while insisting it will not be a "tax".

title.children: Coalition puts EV drivers on notice over road use tax

image.altText: Close up Albanese, smiling, scaffolding in background.

props.synopsis: The crucible of a campaign tests who has what it takes to be a leader. With less than a week to go, we're starting to who has passed the test.

title.children: Albanese eyes history — unless Dutton pulls off a last-minute miracle

image.altText: Harry McKay of the Blues celebrates a goal

props.synopsis: Carlton has won three straight after starting the season with four consecutive losses, toppling Geelong by 18 points at the MCG.

title.children: Carlton continues resurgence with upset over Geelong, Hawks back to winning ways

image.altText: Wests Tigers players jump on Adam Doueihi to celebrate an NRL win.

props.synopsis: Adam Doueihi slots a penalty goal in the second period of extra time to boot the Tigers to a 20-18 victory over Cronulla.

title.children: Marshall hails golden-point win as 'the pressure reliever we needed'

image.altText: people holding placards in a march to protest violence against women

props.synopsis: Protest organisers decried the lack of action around violence against women as hundreds marched in the NSW Central Coast inspired by the death of local Audrey Griffin.

title.children: Hundreds brave rain to protest gendered violence after death of woman

image.altText: An ariel view of law enforcement officers work at the site of a car bomb

props.synopsis: Russia's FSB security service says it has detained a suspect over the car-bomb killing of a senior Russian military officer.

title.children: Russia claims to detain Ukrainian suspect in Moscow car bombing

image.altText: Three men wearing royal blue and yellow prison uniforms stand next to each other with their hands cuffed

props.synopsis: Football teammates from Utah become cellmates in a foreign prison after allegedly joining rebel forces in the Democratic Republic of Congo.

title.children: How three Americans allegedly conspired to overthrow the DRC government

image.altText: A woman in a swimsuit on a boat

props.synopsis: Queensland tourism officials are harking back to the 1980s with a campaign based on a cover of Madonna's hit Holiday to tempt people back to the state.

title.children: Queensland tourism campaign taps nostalgia with Madonna hit

image.altText: Woman wearing red plaid shirt standing in covered patio.

props.synopsis: Can one partner meet all of our emotional and sexual needs? Meet the polyamorous Australians questioning relationship norms, and redefining what love and loyalty looks like.

title.children: Polyamory is becoming more common, but it can still carry stigma and shame

image.altText: A silhouette of Lai, showing the damage to his limbs.

props.synopsis: It's been 50 years since the end of the war in Vietnam but an area "the size of Tasmania" is still grappling with unexploded bombs.

title.children: These explosives keep on killing 50 years after the Vietnam War

image.altText: Jack Robinson, holding the Australian flag above his head, sitting on the shoulder of supporters after winning at Bells Beach

props.synopsis: Aussies Isabella Nichols and Jack Robinson have completed one of the finest days in Australian surfing, claiming the women's and men's finals at Bells Beach.

title.children: Nichols and Robinson win Bells Beach crowns to complete Aussie double

image.altText: orange red and black smoke bellow from a port after an explosion

props.synopsis: A spokesperson for Iran's crisis management organisation said there had been prior warnings over the containment of the chemicals at the port.

title.children: Death toll rises after suspected chemical explosion at Iranian port

image.altText: Older man with arm around woman holding stubby coolers, wearing hats, standing in front of back of tin house.

props.synopsis: As property prices continue to skyrocket across most of Australia, there are still pockets of cheap homes in regional communities.

title.children: Tiny town with properties under $100k keeps home ownership dream alive
